poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: That Octopus vulgaris, precooked, Presenting its little hole to me In a chuckable plastic monstrance Should mimic a succulent cactus - Something a zombie might Tuck behind its ear - is not what got to me But the fact that one, on a sinecure In San Diego Zoo, escaped at night To dine on rare crabs in a neighbouring tank And then snuck back.
